answers.answer: Cotton wool spots are tiny whitish lesions on the retina that look like a tiny piece of cotton. They come from the retina not getting enough blood (ischemia) they are most commonly due to high blood pressure or diabetes but other things can cause them.I cannot tell you anything more. I would suggest you see a Eye MD physician ophthalmologist. Your optometrist is not a physician, does not have a MD nor the extended training of an Eye MD. You can ask your family MD or the MD that treats your blood pressure to refer you or go to www.geteyesmart.org and find an Eye MD near you.JCH MD
Thank you so much.My appointment is next Monday.Hope all is fine.Worried

question: HiI have been diagnosed High blood pressure and diabetic about 7 weeks agoAnd my optometrist doing Corton wool spots on my right retinaWhat does it mean.  Is it dangerous.  Will I turn blind. Do I need surgeryScared
